wikipedia_page.main: Stewart Peter Hamill (born 22 January 1960) is a Scottish former footballer who played in the Football League for Leicester City, Scunthorpe United, Northampton Town and Scarborough.

response: Partnered in attack by Phil Walker or Stewart Hamill, Mell was Scarborough's leading scorer with 16 Conference goals (18 in all competitions) as they won the division, six points clear of favourites Barnet, to become the first team to benefit from the introduction of direct promotion and relegation between Conference and League in place of the longstanding re-election system. He scored at each end of the run of 13 consecutive away wins that made a major contribution to their progression from mid-season mid-table to the penultimate game of the season that confirmed them as champions.
